title: Print, Gewebter Boden Belag Neptun (Neptune Woven Floor Covering), plate 13, in Die Quelle: Flächen Schmuck (The Source: Ornament for Flat Surfaces)
description: Abstract swirling motif in gray and orange-red. Stylized sea plant motif in orange-red on either side of title in oval text block, lower center; text in orange-red and turquoise:  GEWEBTER / BODEN / BELAG / NEPTUN. Verso: Portfolio title in gray in text block, upper left.  Vertical rectangles alternating with small squares in gray on cream.

title: Print, Tapete Masken (Masks Wallpaper), plate 20, in Die Quelle: Flächen Schmuck (The Source: Ornament for Flat Surfaces)
description: Abstract heart-shaped leaf pattern in purple in text block lower center: TAPETE / MASKEN. Abstract bird faces in purple and orange on purple and cream-stippled background. Verso:  Title of portfolio in gray in text box upper left.  Abstract vine motif in gray on cream.

title: Print, Schablonierter Wanddecor Agahippe (Agahippe Stencilled Wall Decoration), plate 19, in Die Quelle: Flächen Schmuck (The Source: Ornament for Flat Surfaces)
description: Text with stylized face in brown in vertical box center left: SCHABLONIERTER WANDDECOR / AGAHIPPE. Design of stylized leaves and berries in brown and pale green. Verso:  Title of portfolio in gray in text box upper left.  Abstract berry and leaf pattern in gray on cream.

title: Print, Frau Nolda Gewebter Wandbehang (Madame Nolda, Woven Wall Hanging), plate 24, in Die Quelle: Flächen Schmuck (The Source: Ornament for Flat Surfaces)
description: Text in brown in small box lower right: FRAU / NOLDA / GEWEBTER / WANDBEHANG.  Stylized palm fronds in pale green and brown. Verso:  Title of portfolio in gray in text box upper left.  Pattern of geometricized leaves in gray on cream.

title: Opera Glasses (France)
description: Frame of aluminum and other metals comprising binocular body with hinged tapering cylindrical handle on one side.  The body, central focusing ring, eye pieces and handle veneered with sheets of mother-of-pearl in irridescent tones of cream to tan.

title: Drawing, Design for Sideboard with Ten Drawers and Ball and Claw Feet
description: Oblong sideboard with four cabriole legs with ball and claw feet decorated with carved acanthus leaves at top of each; tri-partite front is serpentine with four conforming drawers at center atop recessed central section which has two drawers with a door on either side; flanking central section on either side, two doors decorated with patera medallions; low backsplash.

title: Drawing, Design for Serving Table with Convex Front
description: Oblong body with convex front, having 2 drawers and raised on 4 straight tapering legs; rectangular lower shelf attaches just above floor level; brass railing across back of table top.

title: Drawing, Design for Long Semi-Circular Writing Table with Railing Atop
Knife (France)

title: Knife (France)
description: Two blades, scissors, file, corkscrew and pick; fluted mother-of-pearl handle with three rivets on each side.

title: Water Bottle Biscuit Tin
description: Tin shaped like a boy scout's canteen decorated with rope knots and bugle.

title: Biscuit Tin (England)

title: Drawing, Design of Wall Decorated with Tiles
description: On squared paper, above, an inverted tear-shaped cartouche with initials RB at top center in red on yellow ground, flanked by stylized burnt orange and yellow foliage with blue and gray circles. Below, singular register with yellow geometrical shapes alternating with three horizontal stripes; below that, alternating every two vertical designs, along dado, all with tall stylized blue blossom flanked by shorter blue blossoms, every two has a square with curved floral motif in yellow and red, all on light yellow and tan ground.
media: brush and watercolor, graphite on tan wove paper

title: Drawing, Study for Title Page, Les Jardins d'André Vera
description: Perspective view of garden in lunette-shaped frame.  In foreground, single parterre with double Greek key motif with espallied yews at four corners.  Arcades with espallied roses and potted flowers beneath, frame either side of central parterre. In distance, a second, more informal, garden leads to two-story house with red roof in center distance which is framed by terraces and trees. "Les Jardins d' André Vera" is written in script in lower margin.
media: pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on tracing paper

title: Drawing, Vue d'une Roseraie (View of a Rose Garden)
description: Tree-lined plan for garden.
media: brush and brown ink, brown wash, white gouache, graphite on tracing paper

title: Drawing, Design for a Gazebo and Terrace Garden
description: View of red-roofed gazebo with rectangular terrace in front, enclosed by walls with trellises.

title: Drawing, Design for Garden Featuring Octagonal Fountain with Sculpture, Flanked by Hemispherical Trellises
description: A round basin with standing female nude in middle surrounded by an octagonal low wall with benches at the four short sides. Four tall symmetrically-placed spruce trees appear outside the short ends of the wall. In the foreground, in the lower left and right corner, are hemispherical trellises with fountains in the form of columns inside. The fountain is surrounded on three sides by a wall with tall trees growing outside.
media: pen and black ink, brush and white gouache, black crayon, graphite on cream tracing paper

title: Drawing, Study for Garden with Path and Arbor

title: Drawing, Garden Trellis and Bench

title: Drawing, Study for Pavillon et Tonnelle (Pavilion and Arbor)

Climbing roses cling to parts of the trellis; additional climbing roses against a stone wall, line the path behind the pavilion. A mass of dark trees can be seen on the other side of the stone wall.
media: pen and black ink, graphite on off-white wove paper

title: Sidewall, The Golden Tiffany

title: Drawing, Design for Woodwork Decor

Stylized palm(?) leaves fill the area on either side and above the clock and join the garland at the two sides ending in a stylized drapery. The decoration is bordered on three sides by a double molding. The clock numbers are only lightly suggested.

title: Drawing, Design for an Armchair for the Swedish Pavilion, Paris Exposition of 1925

Sketches in graphite of two details–the tip of the base of the chair and one of the chair legs–appear in the center of the composition. Another sketch, perhaps of a back chair leg, appears on the far right.
media: graphite and red, brown, and grey color pencil on beige tracing paper

Triangular shapes in black and orange on yellow fill edges. Verso:  textile design seen from the top with criss-crossing diagonal green and orange bands on yellow ground.  Bottom and right side of textile also visible with continuation of orange and green bands on yellow ground.

title: Print, 28 Rijen 1918, Plate VI, "Sest Dob Nashi Historie" Portfolio

Rays of light emanate from group.

Below the horned animals, two birds, each lowering their beaks towards blossoming flowers at the lower center. Chains connect the fixture to a mount.

title: Print, Un Peu... (A Little...)
description: A woman sits on a hill covered in red, yellow, and blue flowers and surrounded by water and a pleasantly cloudy sky. The figure is dressed in a white country dress by Jeanne Paquin with striped accents and flowers. She wears a yellow hat ringed with flowers and delicately ponders the daisy in her hands. The image is framed in a red border and is captioned beneath.

title: Print, Robe d'après-midi en charmeuse, garnie en perles mates, from Gazette du Bon Ton
description: In an interior, a woman in matching suit jacket and floor-length skirt, looks at self wearning a large black hat in the standing mirror to her left. Background, fur coat sits upon day bed behind her.

title: Print, Gazette du Bon Ton (Journal of Good Taste), Vol. 1, No. 9, L'Oiseau Bleu (The Blue Bird), Plate 5
description: At right, a figure of a woman in draped pale blue coat with cinched bell-sleeves and side gathering with tassles wears single blue feathered headband. She looks off to the side as she feeds the parrots behind a cage.

title: Print, Gazette du Bon Ton (Journal of Good Taste), Vol. 1, No. 11, La Jeune Maman (The Young Mom), Plate 3
description: In an exterior scene, a figure of a young mother stands holding her small child examining the flower blossoms on a tree. She wears a bonnet and matching red and purple day dress with sheer sleeves that cinches at the natural waist with a blue bow. Behind her is a large house with many windows and sweeping gardens with some sculptures.

title: Print, Plate 4, Au Jardin des Hespérides (In the Garden of the Hesperides), Gazette du Bon Ton (Journal of Good Taste), Vol. 1, No. 11
description: In a garden, a woman stands to the right of a tree blooming with golden apples and a pond with a white swan. Holding an apple in her hand, she is pictured from the side wearing a grey checked day dress and matching cape. Her black and grey hat, with a single black feather, sits tall upon her head. The illustration references the Garden of the Hesperides in Greek mythology, a garden guarded by a group of maidens, or Hesperides, that contained a tree bearing golden apples that granted immortality once consumed. The image is framed in a black border and is captioned beneath.

title: Print (France)
description: The caption reads: “VOICI DES FLEURS, DES FRUITS, DES FEUILLES ET DES BRANCHES…” Robe du soir de Paquin. Center woman stands in a tiered white Grecian gown with blue floral accents and hanging beads and matching headband.  In her left hand she holds a bowl of assorted fruits. Left bottom, woman in in pale blue tiered gown with winged shoulder piece and matching headband holds a large bouquet of flowers.

title: Print, Gazette du Bon Ton (Journal of Good Taste), Vol. 2, No. 10, La Dernière Lettre Persane (The Last Persian Letter), Plate 73
description: Fashion illustration depicting a woman walking a dog. Holding the leash in her right hand and a cane in her left, she wears an ochre-colored columnar skirt and cloche hat, white blouse, and black and white detailed large coat with standing color and cuffed sleeves. The dog is behind her, gazing up. Printed text below.

title: Print (France)
description: The caption reads: Le Pas De Scottish Espagnole / Robe du soir, de Worth. Back facing the viewer, a woman stands wearing a copper colored low-back evening gown with lace detailing and black beading. Her dress reveals her matching heels that lace up the ankle. In her left hand she holds a large plummed fan.

title: Print, Gazette du Bon Ton (Journal of Good Taste), Vol. 2, No. 10, Plate 13
description: On cream ground, a figure of a woman stands in an off-shoulder drop-waist pink floor-length dress with mauve and pink floral applique and ruffles at the hem of the sleeves and skirt. In her white-gloved hands she holds a matching parisol and sports a similarly decorated wide-brimmed sun-hat with floral accents. Flower petals at her feet.

title: Print (France)

She wears a full-length beige dress with thick blue sash tied in a bow at the waist and matching beige jacket with blue trim along the edges and bell sleeves.  She also wears matching oxfords and large brimmed sunhat with blue bow.

Ruffles trim the square neckline and line the inside og the wide cuffed sleeves.  The similarly split fron skirt's side pannels have blue horizontal stripped pannels.  She wears matching beige pointed  heels with straps that cross over the top if the foot.

On card 51
One of two circular buttons made in two parts, brass shanks. Each one shows "US" above a hook and oar with a life preserver and "L.S.S." (Life Saving Service) below. Reverse of a: Scoville Mf'g Co. Waterbury

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Imitation leather. Geometric design of interlacing bands with embossed edges. These bands encircle alternately a square and a rosette, each with an embossed design center. Field is plain. The entire surface is antiqued by hand. On reverse side is printed: "8811".

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Symmetrical design composed of foliage, drawn on a larger scale. Center motif subjects: an artichoke with branching acanthus leaves on either side. From the top is growing a spray of three small flowers from which spring forth three buds. The design is that of a Queen Anne or early Chippendale damask which this flock paper simulates. Embossed fine horizontal lines on background.
media: block-printed and flocked on a ribbed paper

title: Sidewall, English Gothic
description: Representing ornamental plaster form of decoration in English Gothic used in the first half of the 19th century. Composed of criss-crossing wide bands ornamented with leaves, flowers, nuts and fruits. Bands are edged with simulated moldings. A reproduction of an old wallpaper from the walls of the front entry of John Sible's house, Hancock Street, Salem, Massachusetts. It was put on walls in 1858. Printed on reverse side: "No. 295 CB". Printed in grisaille on pale gold field. Not original colors.

title: Sidewall, Governor Gore
description: Alternating rows of pheasants and peacocks, each bird perched on bough of a small tree. Each tree has a variety of different colored flowers. Butterflies are flying about. A reproduction of an English paper over 100 years old which was used in the Governor Gore Mansion at Waltham, Massachusetts. Printed on reverse side: "Birge Waterfast Glaze-tek, Governor Gore sidewall 3178 D".

title: Sidewall, Adam
description: This motif has a decided Adam influence. It is composed of small oval medallions containing a classic urn alternating with an oval stylized petalled flower. These two motifs in turn are enclosed in a diamond shaped lozenge with an ornamental outline which gives the effect of parallel diagonal lines. Reproduced from an Adam Brothers design. Printed on reverse: "Birge waterfast Adam Sidewall 2915 C".

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Printed for Nancy McClelland of New York City. A highly stylized design of single five to six petalled flowers in pink with mauve centers. Leaves are gray and white horizontal stripes. Printed in pink, mauve and white on slate gray field.

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Printed in art deco style of decoration for Nancy McClelland of New York City. Gold scrolls scattered in a haphazard way over the gray background. Printed in old Roman gold on slate gray.

title: Sidewall, Cenelle
description: Reproduction of a period paper, printed by Nancy McClelland. Used in Lafayette Bedroom at Mount Vernon, Virginia. Two alternating medallions. The circular one encloses a cluster of flowers with small branches of small leaves. Oblong medallion contains a spray of swinging flowers and fruit with long serrated leaves. The ground between medallions is covered with geometric motifs and tiny dots and dashes. Printed in apricot, green, black and ivory on gray ground.

title: Butter Dish (England)
description: Round dish with a single handle formed by a loop of silver wire, set with a stone.

title: Cymric Brooch
description: Horizontal, symmetrical with two segments enameled in dark blue surrounding a polychromed segment in orange, yellow and green.

title: Teapot (USA)
description: Round body with sharp-beaked spout balanced by a handle running from top to bottom, the handle of walnut connected to the body by thin metal flanges; cylindrical metal fitted cover topped by a finial of walnut between two metal round tabs.

title: Vase (USA)
description: Hammered cylindrical vase gently narrowing at the top with a simple decoration of German silver in a Native American pattern, a double band encircling the vase with a dropping design at four points.

title: Plate (USA)
description: Cream-colored ground with a decorative pattern of a dark blue circle on the edge from which are suspended four designs connected by fine blue lines to a fine blue inner circle, alternating with three brown brown squares, with the Roycroft logo in one panel.

title: Brooch (England)
media: cut and entwined ribbon silver, with basse-taille enamel

title: Sidewall (possibly France)
description: Stylized landscape views of trees on hills. The tree foliage has the appearance of cotton, Printed in white and borwn on a bright orange ground.  Diagonals and stylized foliage.

title: Book Illustration, Sandwich Glass, plate XVII
description: NK5112 .W5X

title: Book Illustration, Les choses de Paul Poiret vues par Georges Lepape (Items by Paul Poiret as seen by George Lepape), Woman in a Turban, plate 6
Book Illustration, Die Fläche (The Surface), Poster design for Spielwaren (Toys)
Lamp Shade, 1907
description: (a) Flower bud form glass shade for sconce. Over-all iridescent finish with green, yellow, orange tones predominating. Green veined, pointed leaf forms rise from base. Out-curving lip with five indentations giving lip slightly lobed outline. (b, c, d, and e) Same basic shapes, colors, free forms of leaves varying slightly. Color variation most noticeable in (c) where color is darker.

title: Vase Vase
description: Tall, smooth pyramidal form, the edges gently flaring to simple short feet; each side with rows of small pierced squares, two below mouth with flared lip, and two just above base. One of a pair (2018-22-136, 137).

title: Sugar Bowl With Lid
description: Circular bowl (a) tapering toward base; blue ground overall, the bottom decorated with band of various sized silver circles, some overlapping, near rim,each trailed by a virtical line; slightly domed glazed and silvered lid with large flat triangular handle having pierced circle at one end.
media: molded and glazed porcelain with silver overlay

title: Ribbon Box, ca. 1915
description: of rectangular form, with canted corners and incurved at the sides, the top and clasp set with small diamonds in platinum and gold settings in the shape of ribbon-tied bows with foliage

title: Textile
description: Printed silk with a stylized design consisting of a cream colored circle with a dark brown and red volute. An umbrella form and a pea pod form in dark brown, turquoise, yellow and red. Design direction reverses every other row. On a red ground.

title: Textile
description: Length of printed silk with a geometric design of circles, stripes, a leaf-like form, and a tulip-like form. In red, turquoise, green, cream, and dark brown.

title: Textile
description: Length of textile printed in the Arts & Crafts style, with a full moon seen through pine trees, reflecting the influence of Japanese design.

title: Hanging Lamp (Italy)
description: Lamp composed of ovoid form glass globe made of thirteen different multi-colored murrines, leaves and rod canes in mosaic technique, set into a manganese colored ground on a clear under ground base, with a cobalt blue finial at the base, surmounted by a domed cap with nine different murrines, leaves and matching ground color, with a hole in the top for an electric wire; the globe surrounded by a polychrome decorated incised wrought iron band with three-winged dragons where rods with spiral twist tops join the structure to the hanging rod.

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Interlocking foliate framework with enclosed stylized flowers. Printed in metallic silver and taupe on light blue ground. Paper embossed to resemble leather.

title: Drawing, Costume Design for a Boyar
description: Russian Constructivist-style costume design of grey-bearded old man in long blue robe and maroon coat and hat with black (fur?) trim. One up-turned hand is raised across figure's chest.
media: brush and gouache, graphite on buff-colored wove paper

title: Cover (France)
description: Small square printed in a black linear design of figures in a landscape with deer. Framed by a diamond border on four sides. Additional colors applied by brush. Probably used as a pillow cover.

title: Cypriote Vase
description: Blown "Cypriote" ware vase with curved shoulder. Neck tapered inward toward plain rim. Lustred in overall mottled iridescent pattern, with four oval reserve panels with lustre applied to suggest upright feather motif.

title: Floor Lamp (Germany)
description: Bronze base (a) with circular foot rising to tapered shaft with long, curved, hinged arm; broad conical parchment shade (b) suspended from end of arm.

title: Side Chair (Germany)
description: Dark brown wood frame comprising rectangular back, seat and base; five tan vertical leather straps on back, eight interlaced straps on seat.

title: Campaign Ribbon, Theodore Roosevelt
description: Black and white woven souvenir with a portrait of Theodore Roosevelt from the 1904 presidential election. Inscription across the top reads "For President. 1904." Along the bottom is the woven signature "Theodore Roosevelt" and the word "Republican."

title: Lincrusta (England or United States)
description: Lincrusta sidewall with geometric grid, floral and insect motifs. Brown glaze original finish.

title: Drawing, Living Room Table, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas
description: Elevation of a long, thin table from the front and the side. Side, with cabinet doors visible, at the left, front at the right.

title: Drawing, Living Room Arm Chair and Carpenter-Type Chair, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas
description: Page with two armchairs. Left, wood frame chair with striped fabric upholstery on seat and back in striped fabric. Right, chair covered in upholstery with wood legs.

title: Drawing, Dining Room Table and Chairs, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas
description: Sheet divided into upper and lower sections. In upper part, from left to right: elevation views of table, one from side and other from front. A green cloth, floral arrangement, and bowl sit atop table. Elevation views from side, back and front of slatted, high-backed side chair cushions. Lower part shows plan of table and side chair.
media: graphite, color pencil on cream tracing paper

title: Drawing, Dresser for Mr. Allen, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas
description: Page divided into two registers horizontally about 3/4 down the page. Upper register, left: side view of wooden dresser with mirror attached atop it, two doors, and four legs; right, front view of same dresser with right door opened to reveal top drawer and three sliding trays inside.

title: Drawing, Living Room and Bedroom Brackets, Hall Mirror, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas
description: Designs for different brackets. Lower left: large square with some pattern detailing. Right, smaller square with no pattern.

title: Drawing, Table and Chair for Mrs. Allen's Boudoir, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas
description: Sheet divided into upper and lower parts. Upper part from left to right shows elevation views of table (front and side); elevation views of chair (side, facing left; front; back). Cloth runner, vase of flowers and book sit atop table. Lower part, in graphite only, shows plan of table, plan of chair and bench at right.
media: graphite, color pencil on cream tracing paper

title: Portiere
description: Pair of portieres with a field decorated by swags descending from rows of architectural pediments. Side and bottom borders have architectural details. Colors are rose red and light brown. Woven so the fabric is reversible.

title: Paperweight (USA)
description: pottery in the form of a scarab, blue and ochre

title: Paperweight (USA)
description: pottery in the form of a scarab, green

title: American Beauty Vase
description: Large hammered copper vase with an elongated neck with flared lip and riveted band around the bulbous bottom resting on flared foot.

title: Tea Kettle on Stand, Model 640 Tea Kettle, Lamp, And Cover
description: Ovoid copper and brass kettle with scrolling handle wrapped in cane; carved wood finial on lid. Brass and copper tripod stand with central shaft decorated by copper foliate ornament; removeable brass burner at top of shaft.

title: Drawing, Wall Elevation Design for Bedroom or Dressing Room
Sample Book, Alfred Peats Set A Book No. 5
description: Catalog of machine-printed papers, some with embossing. Many designs contain metallic pigments in a variety of colors. All the samples are showing matched sets of sidewall, frieze and ceiling paeprs with multiple colorways of many of the patterns.

title: Landscape with Snowcapped Mountains Scenic Plaque
description: White clay body, cast. Rectangular plaque set in plain oak frame. Underglaze decorated with scene of snow-covered mountains with cluster of tall pine trees on right; trees fill middle ground. Label on back of frame identifies these mountains as the Cascade Range in Washington. Trees in greens and browns, mountains in grays and white. Sky shading from a peach into blue-green. Vellum glaze on front, cracklature. Back and sides not glazed.

title: Vase (USA)
description: Gray-white clay body, molded. Tall, slender, slightly cylindrical body with globular shoulder, no neck, incurving rim; no foot. Design of vertical flowers (stylized carnations) and curving leaves that rise up onto the shoulder. Beneath and between these are smaller flowers and leaves. A few random dots on top of shoulder. Decoration in metallic lustres on an iridescent ground, in shades of peacock blue, lavender, crimson, and green against a copper glaze ground, particularly lustrous at the base.

title: Drawing, The Beneficence of the Law, Design for Mural at Essex County Court House, Newark, NJ
description: The figure of Law, with an open book in her lap and a golden scepter in her left hand, is seated before a curved group of four columns. Peace sits at right with an olive branch, and Justice floats above to the left, holding scales. Below, a half-nude woman gives fruits to cherubs, symbolizing prosperity.
media: brush and oil over black chalk on canvas

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Stripe design, wide bands of white alternating with narrow bands of green.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Art nouveau; fantasy flower on heavy stem with leaves on each side. Curved large leaf-like forms are enclosing the flower which repeats half-drop vertically. Broken heavy lines, giving a textured effect, fill the background. Printed in blues, greens, black and shades of brown.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Art nouveau; open and closed tulips with acanthus leaves surrounding the flowers. Smaller leaves and scrolled stems are placed between tulips. Printed in greens, reds and olive on a gold mica background.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Art nouveau; four round roses in horizontal surrounded by leaves shaping a round tree-like form on long intertwined stems which end in two loops. Three vertical lines with small leaves run through the paper nine inches apart. Two looped ribbons are placed on each side of the motif. Printed in pink, shades of red and green.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Cluster of three round pink roses on stems. Roses are printed on vertical stripes and are connected by swags. Printed in pink, green, tan and brown.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Art nouveau; motif of two roses with three leaves is arranged in a half circle. Underlying in full circle are oblong leaves forming a wreath. In its center are small three-leaved motifs. The background is stippled. Printed in shades of green, brown, black and pink on a gold background.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Large acanthus leaves in vertical direction, enclosed in stems and on textured background. Printed in shades of green.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Vertical stripes, seven inches and two inches, alternating. Two stylized tulips on long stems touching a large carnation with two leaves to each side. The whole deisgn simulates tapestry technique with darkness and highlights in the background. Printed in beige, green, black and red.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Five inch stripe, vertical, with lines in its center and heraldic-type motifs . Two laurel branches are placed between the motifs. A weave-like texture fills the background. Printed in brown, green, terra cotta, beige and gold.

title: Frieze (USA)
description: Crown frieze with an oval band, five inches wide, with a heraldic motif and acanthus leaves at its bottom. Similar motifs are placed at each side of oval band. At bottom runs a three inch stripe, vertically, with rings and shadow running through its center. Textural background. Printed in shades of green, brown, gold mica and terra cotta.

title: Crown Frieze (USA)
description: Garland of roses and small rinceaux forming a heartshape with rose motif set in its top. Small cinquefoils are placed inside the heartshape. On each side is a large rose placed in a bouquet. A floral garland is running along the border. Printed in shades of red, green, gold mica, pale blue and off-white.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Bouquet of different roses caught in acanthus leaves. Ribbons and bows decorate the floral arrangment. Printed in shades of red, green and yellow on a beige background.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Two vertical stripes 4 1/4 inches wide and 5 inches apart. Fleur de lis motifs run in the center of the stripes. A weave simulation in verticals covers the background. printed in shades of green, beige, off-white and gold mica.

title: Frieze (USA)
description: Heraldic shield on large cartouch, on red background having appearance of fabric.

title: Sidewall - Sample (France)
description: Cats playing with coils of wool and mice. Baskets with floral arrangements. Pindots cover the background. Printed in red, beige, pink, gold, ocher, black and green. Possibly a children's wallpaper.

title: Frieze (USA)
description: Realistically rendered grape vines, with leaves, bearing both red and purple grapes, on background shading from dark to light green.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Large clusters of purple grapes, with lush foliage, supported on trellis.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Floral bouquet in medallion, printed in void of moire-like background. Printed in green, pink and white.

title: Frieze (USA)
description: Narrow floral medallion frieze, printed in browns and liquid mica white, with medallion being connected by floral swags, above guilloche banding and small floral banding.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Architectural design of a coffered or relief design. Octagon shape defined by a molding enclosing an octagon egg-and-dart frame. Center shows a hexagonal rosette. Printed in sepia tones.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Over-all vermicelli pattern created by cross-hatch lines, overprinted by broad vertical striped ribbons. Printed in beige, ochre and brown.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Diaper or foliate stripe design containing vining foliage printed in red on red ground. Half the background is printed in deep red with the foliate pattern revealed in the void, while on the other half the design is printed in deep red on a textile-patterned light red ground.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Staggered anthemion motifs in black on a red ground.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Stylized floral bouquet forming stripes, printed in green on mottled red ground.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Stylized floral stripe; groups of three roses, in mosaic or stippled design, on spotted background. Printed in light red on deep red plaid background.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Grape and trellis design. Rustic dark brown trellis supports forming perfect squares, from which hang bright blue grape clusters. Printed on tan ground.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Grape and trellis design. Rustic light tan trellis supports forming perfect squares, from which hang bright blue grape clusters. Printed on off-white ground.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Floral wreaths on stripe. Printed in red on red ground.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Floral stripe design. Single poppy flower with foliage on long stem. Flowers printed against a textured brown stripe, alternating with a black stripe.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: All-over pattern of tree-tops with dense foliage and occasional tree branches and hints of sky. Printed in shades of green on white ground.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: Floral stripe design. Pink and white flowers with buds printed on narrow stripe. This alternates with wider stripe. Printed on  spotted green background.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: All-over vining floral design. Large-scale flower set within foliage that forms a diamond trellis pattern. Printed in pink on pale pink mica background.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: All-over design of spiderwebs on background of tiny dots and very fine vermicelly-lines. Printed in beige, green, dark beige  on eggshell background.

title: Sidewall - Sample (USA)
description: All-over design of spiderwebs on background of tiny dots and very fine vermicelly-lines. Printed in yellow, brown, pale chartreuse on a cream background.

title: Hanging, Earth
description: Landscape with conical island mountains. In front, hill with animals and small trees. Greens, white and blues with some yellow and salmon. Border of inbricated fans. Crepe ground.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Tropical Flowers
description: Pattern of tropical flowers in pink, orange, yellow, green, and burgundy on cream ground.
media: printed proof, six colors with graphite oultine of repeat

title: Textile (possibly Austria)
description: Furnishing textile with vertically symmetrical pattern of ogee forms enclosing flowers in an Art Nouveau style. Colors are pale yellow, ivory, and two shades of green.

title: Dish (England)
description: Circular dish with deep concave center.  Outer edge with seven chased lobes.  Wide flat border rises in curve toward center, chased with seven foliated poppy stems with seven blossoms, seven buds, four seed pods, three butterflies, and two flies, all in high relief.  Stems continue into recessed center as stylized swirls and lobes.  Textured hammered surface visible in all flat areas, smooth on central lobes.  Reverse of dish heavily patinated.

title: Dye Record Card (USA)
description: Four cards showing examples of yarns dyed by the Society. All samples have been saved on admission tickets to the Annual Exhibition in 1908. Recipes for some colors are written on the backs of the cards.

title: Drawing, Costume Design: No. 135, Two Little Breads, for Blue Bird
Tile (USA)
description: Octagonal molded tile. Black glazed border enclosing molded (cloisonne) figure of Dutch girl and windmill, both in black silhouette on white ground

title: Book Illustration, Colour Harmony and Contrast: For the Use of Art Students, Designers, and Decorators...; Modification of Tone and Hue of a Colour when placed on or near Different Colours, pl. 8
Border (USA)
description: Red flower sporting two leaves occupies lower pendant section, alternating with smaller flower centered between two larger leaves. Printed in very washed out colors on a tan ground. Heavy metallic gold outline around different elements. Bottom edge of border is cut out around border design. Hole punches along top edge.

title: Balcony Balustrade, Model GI
description: Rectangular form with slightly bowed outline with two panels of curvilinear scrolls ending in foliate motifs.

title: Print, Catalogue for the Karasz Exhibition, Hanfstaengl Galleries, New York, NY
description: Tri-fold booklet with printed black text throughout. One large reproduction of a linoleum cut print featuring a female nude standing underneath a curving leafy tree, her arms bent upwards, a robe draped over her right arm. Printed details contain the dates and title of the exhibition and titles of the included prints.

title: Sample (USA)
description: Reproduction textile inspired by a French eighteenth century example in the Cooper Union Museum collection. Design has figures in Chinese costume fishing in a small boat with water lilies and other plants on a blue ground.

title: Samples (USA)
description: Reproduction textile samples adopted from a Lucchese design in the collection of the Cooper Union Museum. Samples (b/g) of black, blue, green, purple, and taupe with gold weft with a pattern of serpentine branches with ogive blossoms and Chinese-inspired monsters and senmurvs between serpentines.

title: Drawing, Spanish Peak in the Rain, Colorado
description: Horizontal view of distant peaks across a wide plain with a canyon cutting through the terrain in the left foreground; buildings in right middle ground; rain falls.
media: brush and gray wash, graphite on paper

title: Drawing, Garden or Terrace Table in Metal
description: Vertical rectangle, ruled borders in graphite. Plan and elevation for a metal garden or terrace table with curving legs and supports, the table top decorated with four cornucopias at center, four diagonal lines reaching to the corners, and a framing rectangular border. Graphite inscriptions below.

title: Drawing, Table with Removable Tray-top in Painted Metal
description: Vertical rectangle, ruled borders in graphite, irregular left edge. Two elevations and one plan view of a design for a metal circular table with four curving legs, joined together by a metal ring with spiraling decoration at half-height. Removable tray tabletop has curving pointed handles at left and right sides plaques decorating the edge. Graphite inscriptions below.

title: Coin Purse (France)
description: Small coin purse that fits inside 1920-21-1-a

title: Drawing, Design for Bridge in Garden Pavilion
description: Design for half-moon bridge in garden pavilion. Flower motif decorates balustrade and supports of bridge. Vegetation drawn on left side of bridge. Scale noted on bottom.

title: teapot Miniature
description: Oval swelling body with wide fluted band. Curved spout partly fluted. Handle squared at top. Lid, with radial fluting, hinged to body. Ball finial.

title: Tea Cloth (France)
description: Small table cover of white linen embroidered in white linen with details in cutwork. Design of slender elongated stems rising and curving up from the border. Cutwork medallion in the corner.

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Chinoiserie: Vignettes of Asian figures amid pagodas and large flowers. Printed in colors on yellow ground.

title: Sidewall - Floral (France)
description: Green branches and leaves with yellow blossoms are shadowed in random arrangement on background of fine gray and white vertical stripes. Drop match.

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Rococo revival-style with very large foliage and scroll design with large cluster of roses as major motif. The match is dropped with join occurring at the center of the bouquet. Printed in pink and gray on a white satin ground.

title: Side Chair Chair
description: Tall back with turned posts, fluted and reeded on front surface, which rise to turned finials.  Caned central panel framed by a system of pierced scrolls and foliations.  Elaborate shell and scroll-carved pierced cresting and front stretcher which lies behind turned, gadroon-capped front legs.  Turned side and rear stretchers and rear legs.  Upholstered in red silk velvet with red silk fringe.
media: walnut, silk; velved seat, caned back

title: Print, Composition, from "Kleine
media:
color woodcut
support: white wove paper

title: Drawing, Front Elevation of Building No. 6, Immeubles Agar
description: Front elevation of a facade of a six story apartment house, with brick window surrounds indicating art nouveau fluidity. Front door and balconies on the upper floors show intricate iron work. Windows on ground level have simpler treatments. Attic is indicated at top of sheet showing four chimneys and dormer windows. Inscriptions on top and lower right.
media: pen and black ink, graphite on heavy tracing paper

title: Drawing, Villa of M. Hemsy, Plan du Premier Etage
description: Floor plan for the first floor of the Villa of Monsieur Hemsy at St. Cloud. Function and scale of rooms noted thruoghout the design. In the background, an intricate abstract floral design.
media: pen and black ink, graphite on paper

title: Blueprint, Plan of Ground Floor of Villa of M. Hemsy, St. Cloud
description: Design and floor plan for the Rex de Chaussee. Floor plan, pictured above center, right, notes rooms. Design in background and around floor plan. Inscription at top and artist's signature at bottom right.

title: Drawing, Villa of M. Hemsy, St. Cloud, Plan du Rez de Chaussee
description: Floor plan for the ground floor of the Villa of Monsieur Hemsy at St. Cloud. The function of each room and their scale is noted throughout the design. Beneath the floor plan is a plan for the paths in the garden.
media: photostat and black ink on paper

title: Drawing, Le Castel D'Orgeval au Parc de Beausejour, no. 9
description: Plan for the private house of Mr. Laurent, left lateral side. Rough stone and brick indicated in the drawing. Scale noted throughout drawing.
media: pen and black, red ink, green color pencil, graphite on tracing paper

title: Drawing, Elevation and Floor Plans of a Four-Room Two-Family House (“Maison 2 Logements de 4 Pièces A”), Type No. 2
description: Design showing the elevation and floor plan for a two family mass-operation house, to be built according to constructional plans devised by Guimard for the post-World War I housing shortage.
media: pen and black ink, graphite on tracing paper

title: Drawing, Rendering of Interior View of Two Family Mass-operational House (Type No. 7)
description: Rendering of interior view of a two family mass-operational house, to be built according to constructional plans devised by Guimard for post-World War I housing shortage.
media: pen and black ink, graphite on tracing paper

title: Print, Elevations, Right and Left Lateral Façades, Castel d'Orgeval, Parc Beausejour, near Paris
description: Elevation plans for the Castel d'Orgeval, Parc Beausejour. The design on the left depicts the right side of the building, and the right depicts the left side. Scale is noted throughout both drawings.

title: Greeting Card, Franco-British Exhibition, London
description: Horizontal rectangle. Valentine's series, official postcards of the Franco-British Exhibition depicting unity between the two nations.

title: Print, The Singer
description: Head of man seen three-quarter view, turned toward left. Three strands of hair fall along right contour of his face. Left side of face is cast in shadow.

title: Blouse Pieces (Philippines)
description: Bodice (c) of sheer fine piña cloth with tiny white cotton floral sprig embroidered at widely spaced intervals. Shallow oval neckline faced with cotton cloth. Sides not seamed. Separate sleeves (a,b) with some sprig repeat in field, deep border of embroidered drawn work with delicate symmetrical floral and arabesque tracery.

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Red, varnished, embossed ground which shows through overprinting of gold.

title: Photograph, Photograph of Apartment Building Designed by Hector Guimard (No. 2)
description: Photograph of one of the apartment buildings designed by Hector Guimard, belonging to a series of photographs documenting his architecture.

description: Photograph of one of the apartment buildings designed by Hector Guimard, belonging to a series of photographs documenting his architecture.

title: Photograph, Photograph of a Floor Plan of an Apartment Building Designed by Hector Guimard (No. 8)
description: Photograph of a floor plan of one of the apartment buildings designed by Hector Guimard, belonging to a series of photographs documenting his architecture.

description: A photograph belonging to a series showing the construction of one of the mass-operational houses designed by Guimard for the post-World War I.

description: A photograph belonging to a series showing the construction of one of the mass-operational houses designed by Guimard for the post-World War I.

title: Border (England)
description: A border and chair rail on one width. To be cut out. Both have rococo scrollwork with architectural moldings, embellished with roses. Both sets have brown scrollwork, gray molding. "a" has white roses with gray shading,"b" has dark red roses. Printed on white ground.

title: Print, An Estuary
description: A broad stretch of sand, with an undulating narrow stream running from the foreground into the distance. Low hills appear on the horizon.

title: Trimming
description: Trimming of flowers with six long white petals and pink centers.

title: Drawing, Portrait of a Woman
description: Vertical rectangle. Head and shoulders of a woman, her head turned sharply to the left, seen almost in profile. She wears a veil with leaves and grapes over her hair.

title: Drawing, Study of landscape, Norway
description: Sketch of a fiord with rock in the background. In the foreground, a narrow strip of land just out into the sea, with a small group of houses in the center.
media: brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

title: Drawing, Monument of the soldiers, sailors and marines
description: Plan of a monument. In upper margin: COMPETITION FOR A MONUMENT IN / HONOR OF THE SOLDIERS SAILORS AND / MARINES WHO SERVED IN THE WAR FOR / THE SUPRESSION OF THE REBELLION. Lower right: 195.
media: pen, brush and black ink, brush and watercolor, wash on paper

title: Drawing, Still-life
description: Horizontal rectangle. A still-life of a bottle, tea-pot, and onions. Signed in pencil, lower right: "Paul./May 8."

title: Textile (Netherlands)
description: Blue on a white ground in an allover floral design imitative of batik from Java.

title: Kimono Fabric (Japan)
description: Kimono fabric with large-scale dragon flies reserved in white and placed at angles across a dark blue ground fabric. Dragon flies appeared cropped at the wings due to the large scale.

title: Drawing, Virginia Modeling, Study for Etching
description: A young girl sitting before a table, with a tool in her hand, modeling a figure in clay. She faces right, in profile. A potted plant or flower arrangement is on the table, right.

title: L'Heure Bleue Perfume Bottle And Box
description: Bottle (a) of heavy molded, clear glass. Body is oblong in section, with chamfered corners, and with shoulders projecting in a scroll form at narrow sides and marked on the face and reverse as a raised thread spiral. Plain cylindrical neck with a convex ring at angle of base, and a flat, extended rim. Stopper (b) has short concave stem surmounted by a finial, moulded as if formed from a lozenge-in-section; glass rod outlining an inverted heart shape with scrolled ends in center. Circular paper label on front side of body with "Guerlain, Paris, L'Heure Bleue."  Box (c) is rectangular, with lid opening from top. Figures and animals top and sides; "Guerlain" on lid.

title: Drawing, Concept Drawing for Blair House, Residence of William McCormick Blair, Lake Forest, Illinois
description: Elevation of two storied house, with portico, terminating in gable roofed wings set at right angles. Suggestion of figures and trees.
media: graphite, pastel on tracing paper mounted on white wove paper (letterhead)

title: Drawing, Study of Peonies
description: Horizontal sheet depicting studies of peonies in graphite, some with gouache coloring on petals.
media: pen and ink, graphite, brush and watercolor on tracing paper

title: Drawing, Study of an Orchid
description: Vertical sheet depicting an orchid with two blossoms. The flowers are paritally colored with black, white, green and pink gouache.
media: pen and ink, brush and gouache, graphite on tracing paper

title: Drawing, Study of Squash Vines
description: Horizontal sheet depicting two studies of squash vines with leaves, tendrils and blossoms.
media: graphite, pen and ink on tracing paper

title: Drawing, Studies of Squash or Pumpkin Blossoms
description: Horizontal sheet illustrating six studies of squash or pumpkin blossoms.
media: graphite, pen and ink on tracing paper laid down

title: Textile (USA)
description: Cream ground with sprays of thistle printed in brown and orange.

title: Drawing, Two Studies of Violet Chrysanthemums
description: Two violet chrysanthemum blossoms, one with stalk, leaf and bud in the center of the page.
media: brush and gouache on grey paper

title: Drawing, Mise en Carte for a Woven Textile
Frieze, The Froebel
description: Children's frieze with repeating group of seven school girls in green and red dresses, holding books, abaci and hoops, with a terrestrial globe. Across bottom a banderole with the Gothic-letter inscription in German: Arbeit macht das Leben Süss [Work Makes Life Sweet]. Printed in top selvedge: Wm. Campbell-Wall-Paper-Co., Antiseptic Pat'd 8-9-04". Printed in bottom selvedge:  "The Froebel, E.J. Walenta, 496".

title: Drawing, Enrico Caruso as Don José in "Carmen"
description: Self-portrait caricature of opera singer Enrico Caruso as Don José in the opera "Carmen." Figure shown from the front wearing a military garment with a sword and a helmut with plume.
media: pen and ink on stationery paper

title: Fragment
description: Fragment with a white ground has an allover design of life-sized roses in pink, green and brown.

title: Ribbon Samples (France)
description: Eight samples of wide ribbon. Background of plain weave with a design of interlacing lines outlined in gold thread. Highly stylized gold rose blossoms and scrolling lines form a border on each side. Both selvages present on all samples. Component "a" has interlacing lines of bright and dark red with gold thread accents.

title: Ribbon Samples (France)
description: Eight samples of wide ribbon each with a solid colored satin ground shot with metallic thread and a design of serpentine pointed, serrated, and ornamental leaves in gold or silver.

title: Textile (France)
description: A tightly-arranged meandering gold ribbon makes a pattern of bow-shapes and knot clusters on a red foundation.

title: Textile (France)
description: A tightly-arranged meandering gold ribbon makes a pattern of bow-shapes and knot clusters on a horizontally striped foundation of blue, red, green, beige, and gray.

title: Textile (France)
description: A tightly-arranged meandering gold ribbon makes a pattern of bow-shapes and knot clusters on a purple foundation.

title: Ribbon Samples (France)
description: Four samples of wide ribbon with a solid satin ground in a design of conventionalized chrysanthemums and zinnias in metallic thread. Foundation is printed with a large, circular group of flowers connected by a vertical flowering vine.

title: Sample (France)
description: Sample woven in horizontal stripes showing twenty-one different colorways. Pattern is an allover repeat of multicolored clusters of round lanterns in an imbricated design with pendant, weighted cords.

title: Sample (France)
description: Sample with twelve stripes showing different colorways has a satin ground divided into lozenges by bands of scroll and floral ornament. Lozenges enclose four different repeats: sphinx and pyramids, water carrier, woman kneeling before altar, and a man riding in a chariot.

title: Sample (France)
description: Textile sample with a satin ground, and a design arranged in staggered horizontal repeat, of a tree with a spray, hanging garland of round roses, and deer leaping between the trees. Design partly in main silk weft, partly in secondary gold weft, and partly brocaded with silver and multicolored silks.

title: Ribbons (France)
description: Vertical motif of roses worked in gold, bronze, and silver colored threads on plain satin ground. Ground colors of a) pink; b) forest green; c) turquoise; d) navy blue; and e) black.
media: silk, metal strips wrapped around cotton core

title: Sample (France)
description: Sample of taffeta with a large-scale geometric and linear design in black cut velvet.

title: Sample (France)
description: Sample of taffeta with a large-scale geometric and linear design in black cut velvet.
